summary: This is an email from Seamus regarding the transfer of three 2TB external hard drives related to the Epstein case. The email discusses logistics for delivering the drives, coordinating with the SDNY (Southern District of New York), and notes the attention the case is receiving from EM (likely Epstein or Epstein-related matters). It emphasizes avoiding delays and includes instructions for updates while a key person is overseas.

persons.name: Frank
persons.context: Addressed in the email as the primary contact for receiving and potentially returning the external hard drives.

persons.name: Seamus
persons.context: Author of the email coordinating the transfer of external hard drives related to the Epstein case and ensuring coordination with SDNY.

connections.description: Seamus is communicating with Frank regarding the logistics of transferring external hard drives for the Epstein case.

events.title: Coordination for Hard Drive Transfer
events.description: Seamus emails Frank about arranging the delivery of three 2TB external hard drives, coordinating with SDNY, and ensuring no delays due to case attention.

keyFacts: Three 2TB external hard drives are being transferred in relation to the Epstein case, indicating significant digital evidence handling.
Coordination with the SDNY (Southern District of New York) is emphasized, showing ongoing federal investigation activity.
The case is noted as receiving attention from 'EM' (likely Epstein or Epstein-related matters), prompting urgency to avoid delays.
A key individual involved is mentioned as being 'OCONUS' (outside continental US) the following week, indicating international aspects or travel related to the case.
